title: Wildfires and Climate Change
description: A short lesson to help you apply Wildfires and Climate Change.

hook.text: In 2020, Australia's wildfires burned 46 million acres â€” an area the size of Syria.

buildup.text: Hotter, drier conditions extend fire seasons and make forests more flammable each year.

discovery.text: Fires release the carbon that forests spent decades storing, pushing warming even further.

twist.text: Burned forests regrow slowly. Some are too damaged to return at all and become grassland.

climax.text: Climate change creates more fires, and more fires accelerate climate change â€” a vicious loop.

punchline.text: Fire is natural. The scale we are seeing is not.

quiz.question: How does climate change affect wildfires?
options: Hotter, drier conditions make forests more flammable
